availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Taylor W. Samuels (Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer and distiller)

body.p: Nelson County, Kentucky, farmer and distiller. Kentucky native. Married to Lavinia Osburn Samuels in Nelson County on January 2, 1845. Father of William J. Samuels, Thomas B. Samuels, Robert Beamis Samuels, Mary Catherine Samuels, and John Samuels. Founded a commercial distillery in Deatsville, Kentucky, in 1844. Farmer in Nelson County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1850. Farmer in Nelson County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Nelson County in 1860. Sheriff in Nelson County in 1861. Farmer in Nelson County in 1863. Distiller in Nelson County in 1865. Sheriff in Nelson County in 1865.
